title.narrative: Providing essential integrated protection, education, Health and WASH services to vulnerable children and their families in the H2 area in Hebron city and Emergency WASH interventions for unconnected vulnerable communities in Area C

description.narrative: The main objective of this multi-sectoral project is to provide urgent humanitarian and protection assistance to vulnerable children and their families in H2 area of Hebron and Area C of the West Bank. UNICEF and partners will use CERF to 1) conduct nutrition screening, treatment and awareness raising sessions for 3,000 children and 1,000 pregnant and lactating women, 2) provide group and individual psychosocial counselling support to 1,250 children and conduct awareness raising sessions to their parents, 3) deploy protective presence personnel to support 500 children and 15 teachers in safely accessing schools, and 4) improve water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services for 10,250 people. An estimated 10,250 people including 5,126 children will benefit from this project, which will be implemented over about nine months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS PALESTINIAN TERRITORY, OCCUPIED UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2019

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: More children and parents in H2 area in Hebron, are benefiting from the provision of PFA, group psychosocial counselling for children, group psychosocial counselling for parents, stress releasing and recreational activities, awareness sessions on children’s rights and needs.
# of children benefiting from group and individual psychosocial counselling support
# of parents who receive awareness sessions and group psychosocial support.
More children and their families benefit from WASH services in H2 area in Hebron and from unconnected water networks in Area C.
# of children and family members benefiting from improved WASH services in H2 area in Hebron.

# of children and family members with improved access to safe water in the most vulnerable communities in Area C through the rehabilitation/construction of water pipe line and rehabilitation of rain water harvesting cisterns.
More children in H2 area, have better nutritional status and opportunities for their growth, academic achievements and better earning potential later in life
# of children (0 to 12 years old; 50:50 ratio boys and girls) benefiting from targeted nutrition interventions (e.g nutrition screening, awareness, provision of supplements)
# of pregnant and lactating women (PLW) benefiting from targeted nutrition interventions (e.g. awareness sessions, cooking demonetisation, emergency IYCF counselling)
More school children and teachers in vulnerable areas have safe access to schools
# of school children and teachers benefiting from Protective Presence services to safely access their schools
